body.header: Read the following statements and decide if they are true or false.

ol.li: You should talk about every question until the Examiner stops you. TrueFalse
Use as many big words as you can - they will impress the Examiner. TrueFalse
Long complex answers which you have memorised will give a good impression of your general knowledge. TrueFalse
A complex sentence always sounds better than a simple one. TrueFalse
You will be penalised if your answers have obviously been learned by heart. TrueFalse
Looking relaxed, intelligent and confident gives the impression that you are relaxed, intelligent and confident. TrueFalse
Answer yes or no to the question, then wait for the next one. TrueFalse
Giving examples and details to fill out your answers will increase your chances of success. TrueFalse
If you are not sure about the question, just say as little as possible about it. TrueFalse
The Examiner wants you to make mistakes so the less you say the better it is. TrueFalse

section.p: 1. Think about how you behave in a normal conversation and try to do the same in the exam.
2. This is a test of communication not vocabulary.
2. Sometimes you communicate better with small words.
3. This is not a test of memory. You will lose marks for learning answers.
3. This is not a test of general knowledge but of communication.
4. If you can communicate your ideas using simple language then that is fine.

p.font: 5. So don't try to learn answers by heart!

section.p: 5. This is not a test of memory but of communication.
6. It also makes examiners feel more comfortable.
6. The way you look and behave gives very strong signals to examiners.
7. This wouldn't give examiners much to judge you on, would it?
7. It is usually a good idea to answer the question and then extend the answer with an example or explanation.
8. Adding to the answer is a good idea.
8. Adding to the answer is a good idea.
9. If you are not sure, then you should ask the examiner to repeat the question or say you don't understand.
9. Always ask for help if you are not sure, this is an important part of communication.
10. Examiners do not mark your mistakes. Your communication is what matters.
10. Examiners want to give you the best chance to show off your skills at communicating in English.
